'''Nindalf''', or '''Wetwang''' in [[Westron]], was a wide region of swampy land of <ref name=UI>{{HM|UI}}, entry ''Nindalf'', p. 334</ref> pathless fen<ref name="Nomen">{{HM|N}}, entry '''Wetwang''', p. 779</ref> on the east side of the river [[Anduin]]<ref name=Map>{{RK|Map}}</ref> near the foot of the falls of [[Rauros]] and the mouths of the [[Entwash]]<ref name=UI/>.

At the Nindalf the Anduin divided into many channels and formed marshlands in the east of the main channel of the river. Opposite of the Nindalf, on the west side of the Anduin the river Entwash flowed into the Anduin by many mouths in a great inland delta.<ref name="Farewell">{{FR|Farewell}}, p. 373</ref> The [[Dead Marshes]] lay further east and may have been an extension of Wetwang.<ref name=Map>{{RK|Map}}</ref>

On [[16 February]] {{TA|3019}}<ref>{{App|Great}}, entry for the year 3019, February, 16, p. 1092</ref> [[Celeborn]] recommended to the [[Fellowship of the Ring]] that those heading to [[Minas Tirith]] should leave the river above the Falls of [[Rauros]] and cross the Entwash before it separates into many mouths in the marshes.<ref name="Farewell"/>

==Etymology==
''Nindalf'' is a [[Sindarin]] name, which means "Wetwang"<ref name="Nomen"/> or "wet flat"<ref name=PE17>{{PE|17}}, entry S '''talan''', p. 52</ref>. It is a compound of ''[[nîn]]'' ("wet")<ref name="Nomen"/><ref name=PE17/> and ''[[talf]]'' ("flat field"<ref name="Nomen"/> or "flat area"<ref name=PE17/>).

The archaic meaning of ''[[wiktionary:wang#Old English|wang]]'' (modern ''[[wiktionary:wong#English|wong]]'') means "field" or "flat area".<ref name="Nomen"/>

==Inspiration==
[[Wikipedia:Wetwang|Wetwang]] is a real-life place-name in Yorkshire.<ref name="Nomen" /> [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] was in command of an outpost of the Humber Garrison in Roos in Yorkshire in 1917<ref>{{L|340}}</ref><ref>{{L|257}}</ref> and 1918<ref>{{L|165}}</ref>, which is not far from Wetwang.

== Portrayal in adaptations ==
'''2012: ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'':'''
:Nindalf can be viewed from atop the Rauros and from the Mouths of Entwash across the Anduin. The area itself however cannot be explored.
